intro: Triumfetta humilis, commonly known as the small triumfetta, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions of Africa, Asia, and Australia. It is a low-growing shrub or herbaceous plant with small, opposite leaves that are usually ovate to elliptic in shape. The flowers are typically small, pale yellow or greenish-white, and clustered in racemes, often appearing in the axils of the leaves. It produces small, round, greenish fruits that contain several seeds. This species is often found in disturbed soils and is used in traditional medicine in some regions.
